intro: Dipsacus daliensis, commonly known as the Dali teasel, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its spiny, bract-like structures that surround its small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its foliage consists of palmately lobed leaves, and it produces a cluster of small, inconspicuous flowers at the base of the spines. Dipsacus daliensis is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its distinctive appearance.
